name: Crowne Plaza Hotel London-Heathrow

reviews.text: In my experience, you can believe both the good AND the bad reviews for this hotel. After arriving in London , on a Saturday afternoon, this hotel provided a tremendous welcome. Good room, responsive staff. Had a very good meal at the restaurant. Everything worked.
reviews.title: Very good to poor in ten days. Talk about inconsistent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ten days later, the evening prior to leaving London, same hotel (at a MUCH higher rate since it was no longer the weekend), and all of the negatives that others have noted were experienced. Inexperienced check in personnel. The room was not clean and had a peculiar odor. Internet connection and most of the television functions did not work. Staff was not responsive to requests for correction of problems.
reviews.title: Better experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a nice sandwich from room service, though.
reviews.title: Dont believe all you read

reviews.text: That was spoiled when my requested wake-up call was not forthcoming.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel near airport

reviews.text: At check-out, hotel personnel were not very responsive to requests for assistance. I did get some help from a couple of other guests, though.
reviews.title: Our London Base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed at the crowne plaza for one night exceeded our expectations as i got such a good deal on last minute.com much nicer than other crowne plaza we have stayed in, upgraded to a club room which was lovely and spacious, had use of the exec lounge which was well worth it for the continental breakfast and free flowing spirits beer soft drink, which was great, just the canapes werent good egg mayo?!
reviews.title: lovely airport hotel we will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: had an excellent meal at the indian restaurant within the hotel, which people seem to overlook for some reason but it was great.
reviews.title: Nice room, hit and miss service, car park security needs improving!
Great airport hotel
reviews.text: shall be defo staying here again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a great deal on a reverse park and fly package. Upon entering the hotel car park it wasn't very clear where you were supposed to park as their were very few signs. We went to reception and they said where we had parked was ok, however as we left the hotel on the shuttle bus it was clear we had parked in the wrong place as we passed the park and fly area. It was nice I thought the staff hadn't asked us to move the car.
reviews.title: We would return to this hotel.

reviews.text: On our return from our holiday we joined a small queue to check in. However for some reason the guests who were at the two open desks seemed to be an age for whatever reason. In the meantime cabin crew from an airline entered the foyer to check out. Rather annoyingly, the hotel opened two desks and waived them over without asking those who had already been queuing for fifteen minutes if they would like to be served first, which I did find rather annoying. It took us 30 minutes before we were actually served.
reviews.title: Very good for children, suprisingly! Beware adjoining room doors.....!

reviews.text: This was a great hotel staff amazing, rooms fantastic size, hotel for what we paid was brilliant, room service was gorgeous, overall a really good experience only stopped the one night though. really comfortable beds although rooms are a little dated it was a great stay.
reviews.title: Lovely Horel

reviews.text: The hotel was OK, nice pool but this was far outweighed by the terrible prices and inconvenient travel.
reviews.title: Just don't go here if you want to take a Logoland holiday (unless you're a millionaire with patience of a saint)

reviews.text: We booked a Legoland five day break, with our three children aged 10 8 and 6.
reviews.title: Best luxury hotel close to Heathrow Airport
Convenient for Stockly Park and Airport
reviews.text: The hotel was advertised as being 'only twelve miles' from Legoland in Windsor.
What WASN'T mentioned was the £50 (one way) taxi fare!!
reviews.title: great hotel horror to find a car park

reviews.text: I booked in for one night in November to take advantage of the park and stay offer. With the hotel room I got 10 nights free parking.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very comfortable. It had a fantastic pool / hot tub / sauna etc. It had air-con, TV satelite and a nice ensuite bathroom.
reviews.title: Solid choice for a hotel in the Heathrow area - good parking and nice service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were spacious and comfortable and despite the hotels proximity to the airport and M4 motorway, it was very quiet.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: I had access to the club lounge with complimentary drinks and snacks and this was very nice.
reviews.title: Top class

reviews.text: One thing to be aware of, the shuttle coach to the airport costs around £3-£4 each way (I can't remember off the top of my head the exact amount), but the coaches were frequent and stopped only once enroute.
reviews.title: Good for a night or two

reviews.text: I have stayed at several heathrow hotels & this is still one of the best, friendly efficient staff and nice rooms i.e. clean, a decent size with good blackout curtains. The pool is nice but very busy as I believe some guests of other hotels also use can use it, the pool changing rooms are dirty & dated. Breakfast is really chaotic with the huge no.s of guests. The hotels is easy to find and gives good access to Legoland(the reason for our stay).
reviews.title: decent airport hotel

reviews.text: I have been working at Stockley Park for the last 6 weeks and have no option but to stay in the local area given the motorways are constantly clogged up. This is probably the worst Crowne Plaza ili have stayed in. In 5 yeas of travel for work (almost alway at ICH Group hotels) I have never felt so overcharged, underwhelmed and disdain ted. The outside looks like a prison, however the lobby is nice. This is where the joy ends. Rude staff, outdated rooms and overpriced services from start to finish. £12 parking, £17 breakfast and £7 drinks in a fairly ropey part of London is outrageous. You must try harder guys!
reviews.title: Best avoided - several better in the area.

reviews.text: I got a very good deal on lastminute.com. I arrived by Hoppa and was a bit put off by all the signs about security in the car park but as I didn't have a car I was not too bothered. I had to wait a while to check in because one of the reception staff had disappeared but the receptionist was very apologetic when I was eventually able to check in. Very pleased with size of room and general cleanliness. I wish I could get an hotel of similar standard for the same price in central London. I did feel a bit cut off due to my reliance on the hoppa service to get anywhere, I though it was a bit expensive, likewise the restaurant - I wouldn't want to stay here for more than one night.
reviews.title: Spacious and clean if a little isolated

reviews.text: Hotel is a very good , near to Airport stay. If you have early morning flight to catch may be a best place to stay.
reviews.title: Nice over night stay

reviews.text: One thing I did not like that it is a bit far from nearest metro. Nearest metro is at terminal 3 which cost approx 10 bucks by taxi.
reviews.title: Kind of old for 4 stars

reviews.text: A word of warning to all travellers, the security at this hotel must be non existent, the parked cars here are constantly broken into and the local crime statistics for theft from motor vehicle just went up nearly 400% because of this hotel car park. The local police have constantly tried to get the hotel to do something about security but they don't seem too bothered.
reviews.title: Don't park here!

reviews.text: If you insist on parking here while you travel empty absolutely everything out and perhaps leave the glove box open so a potential thief will leave your vehicle alone.
reviews.title: Lovely pre-flight hotel

reviews.text: Arrived early afternoon and did not have to wait in queue. Staff member asked if I would like a wake up call seeing as I was flying out early the next day. I didn't opt for one but it was nice to be asked.
reviews.title: the worst service we have ever experienced.

reviews.text: Room was spacious, very handy for preflight packing. I had a big L shaped desk and a chushy executive chair. TV was on a lazy susan type base so it could be turned toaward the desk.
reviews.title: Perfect pre flight choice

reviews.text: The Champions League final was on that night and a few people had already gathered in the bar, decked out in their team colours, so I decided have Room Service. It was an extra 2.95 (i think, around abouts) for service and the prices of the food seemed to be the same as the restaurant downstairs. I was happy to pay the extra to be able to eat in my pyjamas! I ordered Lasange, salad and a waffle for dessert. The food wasn't spectacular but was exactly what I needed - just food.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: Stayed here for a business trip and was generally happy with my stay. The staff are attentive and very helpful and the hotel facilities were great. Would definitely recommend this hotel to any travellers looking to rest before a flight as the location is perfect for LHR.
reviews.title: Convenient and quality stay at Crown Plaza

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Difficult to fault this hotel. Staff are always courteous, friendly and helpful. Rooms are well presented and a good size. Very importantly it has easy access to Heathrow without suffering from airport noise. Food is good and so are the bars. Can't be bettered for a Heathrow stay.
reviews.title: Best Heathrow Hotel For Location, Quality and Service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked with lastminute.com as a top secret hotel and had a really good deal , check in was fast and our room was really spacious ,clean and welcoming . The location was extremely convenient for us and we travelled into London for £8.50 which covered all our travel by local bus to West Drayton then a train to Paddington and all tube and bus travel all day . We will use this hotel again for our base for a weekend in London rather than using overpriced poor quality accomodation in the Capital . Didn't have the time to use the exellent looking leisure facilities and we didn't eat at the hotel either so can't comment . Parking was £12 which is a bit steep but cheaper than parking all day in London
reviews.title: Perfect Stay , will return

reviews.text: The hotel was amazing and the rooms were spectacular. Yet, I was so turned off by the slow service ( i had to call the front desk multiple times to get one thing done). The price of things were so incredibly high. I usually visit other places in Europe and this hotel really caused a dent in my trip to London.
reviews.title: Uhhh.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got this hotel on a "Park & Fly" rate with Holiday Extras. £89 to park the car for 2 weeks and included an overnight stay on Room Only basis ..
reviews.title: GOOD HOTEL FOR HEATHROW AIRPORT

reviews.text: Stayed for one night before flight to Australia from Heathrow.
reviews.title: Perfect airport hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't comment on the bar or restaurant as we were so tired we never used them. However the room was excellent. Very spacious and spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Poor Service

reviews.text: There was a "sleep" kit with pillow spray and roll on serum which was a nice touch. Well stocked mini bar and plenty of towels and shower gel etc.
reviews.title: slight improvements needed

reviews.text: Perfect overnight stay. We booked a private transfer to airport which arrived on time. Check out procedure and return from holiday procedure seamless. Will definitely use again.
reviews.title: Modern lounge/bar - forgot to update the rooms & service

reviews.text: Being a Priority Club member and having stayed in Crowne Plaza Hotels around the world we found the service at this hotel very poor.We had booked an Executive room at this hotel 6 months ago and had indicated that we would be arriving before check-in time. Arriving at the hotel at 12.30 pm after a long flight, we assumed as is normal practice in most other hotels that we would be able to check-in, leave our bags and then return at the advertised check-in time to collect our key. Check-in was refused and we were told to return at 3 p.m. however they did store our bags. Arriving back at the hotel at 4.00 pm we were informed that our room would not be available until 5.30 p.m. While waiting to speak to the manager an alternative room to the one we were originally allocated became available even though they had stated there were none free. The problem appears to be that flight crews do not vacate the rooms at the normal checkout time. Be aware that you therefore may not be able to gain access to your room at the allocated time. We had no complaints about the room and it was of the standard we expected for an airport hotel. The next problem occurred when we went to the restaurant at 7.15 for dinner. We were told that it was closed for a private function until 8 pm even though the restaurant was now almost empty. That the restaurant was closed to guests until 8.p.m. should have been conveyed to us at check-in and we could have made alternative arrangements. The Executive Lounge staff, drinks and breakfast were good, however the finger-food was poor in quality and quantity.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: I had no issues with this place, check-in was fast simple and the clerk informed me of free internet for that day, my colleagues however, complained that their check in clerk was less than helpful. Room was great, spacious and comfortable, loved the big desk area, I had no problem getting work done. I'd say, this is probably the best place to stay close to the airport, great restaurant, great little pub and store in the lobby. Check-out was fast and their was always taxis waiting outside.
reviews.title: Easy Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stopped here the night before flight.
reviews.title: Good hotel for Heathrow Airport

reviews.text: Good clean room. Breakfast was included in the rate and was of good quality....buffet, help yourself, anything from full english to continental.
reviews.title: Very confortable

reviews.text: Only negative comment is that they charge £12/night for parking...ouch!.
reviews.title: Pleasant and functional hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on a leisure rate which was £70 (breakfast included). We would stay again at this rate.
reviews.title: Above and beyond

reviews.text: Well, my trip to London started with not having my luggage in the morning. When I arrived at the Crown Plaza in the evening I was informed that my luggage had arrived, but then it was a mistake and it turned out that they had a false entry in their log files. Given this initial confusion and the fact that my room type was not available anymore when I checked in, I was not too pleased. However, the gentelman who checked me in was very cordial and went out of his way to assist me.
reviews.title: High priced, but good location close to Heathrow airport

reviews.text: The hotel is located in the vicinity of Heathrow airport, but then there is nothing more to it than that. The exterior is appaling and when you arrive you wonder where you ended up staying for the night. However, the hotel is quite nice on the inside with a modern design. The rooms are decently spacious for the London area and are quite nice, offering amenities like a safe, ironing board, mini-bar, bath robes, tea station and cable internet access against fee. The rooms are very clean, but I was not pleased about the fact that there was no compendium in the room that explainded the hotel facilities.
reviews.title: disappointed

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was good with tasty hot and cold items served. The service was efficient and friendly. The Crown Plaza Heathrow offers a free shuttle service to nearby business areas (like Stockley Park) in the morning and evenings, which is very convenient and worked very well.
reviews.title: Clean, value for money Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is frequented by airline personnel, business travellers and famlies. Given the price range they cater to a "higher" clientel. It was a good stay for me, but the price for the rooms is acutally to high for what is being offered.
reviews.title: Great for an overnight stay before flying

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel many times before and have always been really pleased, however on this occasion we where somewhat disappointed, the reason for this is on arrival there was a complimentary bottle of water in the room which had been opened and some had been drunk, our room was very warm and although the air con was set at its lowest 18c it must have been faulty as the temperature would not reduce. At breakfast twice I asked for tea,coffee and some warm milk for my daughters cereal but never got. Parking was an absolute nightmare not one space throughout the car park I had to park on yellow lines.
reviews.title: Very comfortable airport hotel

reviews.text: Booked this hotel through Hotwire and got a fairly good deal.
reviews.title: Ok - better hotels in the area

reviews.text: Rooms were nice and large but service from reception and the concierge were average. Left to wait for ages to check out and then when someone did come to help us they left us again to speak to a colleague!
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Having read the reviews I was worried about leaving my car in the car park but I managed to find a spot pretty much in front of reception and had no issues.
reviews.title: Incompetent and arrogant staff

reviews.text: We tried to get through to the hotel to order us a taxi from Heathrow but no one ever answered - but we eventually managed to get one from T5.
reviews.title: Great hotel as Legoland base

reviews.text: Thing to note - the Hoppa Buses stop at midnight so if you have a late flight you'll need to get a taxi!
reviews.title: Not like all airport hotels

description: The newly refurbished Crowne Plaza London Heathrow Hotel is conveniently located for all Heathrow airport terminals including the new Terminal 5. In addition M4 & M40 are only minutes away. The Hotel is just 2 minutes from Stockley Park. Complimentary transfers offered to Stockley Park whilst Bedfont Lakes Business Park is only a short drive away. Crowne Plaza London Heathrow is an ideal base while on Business or to explore Central London, Legoland Windsor, Ascot Racecourse, Wembley and Twickenham. All bedrooms are spacious, modern & equipped with air conditioning and high speed internet. The Hotel offers family rooms & accessible rooms including one with hoist facilities. Why not upgrade to the Club floor with access to Crowne Plaza Club Lounge where you can enjoy complimentary Continental Breakfast, complimentary WiFi in the lounge, drinks & canapés. Crowne Plaza London Heathrow is the place to Meet with 23 meeting and conference rooms for up to 200 delegates. All conference rooms have natural daylight and WiFi. Crowne Plaza London Heathrow is the ideal Legoland hotel for exploring all the park has to offer with journey times to the park of only 20 minutes The Hotels Leisure Club Spirit boasts Heathrow's largest indoor pool, whirlpool, sauna and fully equipped gym and treatment rooms. Uniquely the hotel has a 9 hole golf course.
